posts.post_content: Coming into play untapped is a huge difference, especially in aggressive decks. With [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse) you're giving up one mana, with these one life. Mana is usually worth more than life.

posts.post_content: Gezus82 because not only do they give you ANY land in your deck untapped (therefore triggering a landfall ability multiple times) they also thin your deck out. imagine these fetchlands in a landfall deck. you get a few landfall +2/+2 effect cards out, then play these and get +4/+4 (minimum!) since they count as lands.

posts.post_content: 18scsc, you're looking at the card wrong. It's not so much 'better' (unless you are playing with duel lands, [Dryad Arbor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dryad Arbor) or those Shadowmoor lands with basic land types), it's that this is effectively an extra 4 copies of [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse). And that's awesome.
